decks.notes: This deck aims to disrupt opponents by using cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also bringing out aggressive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to pressure the opponent. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Solitude and Fatal Push to control the board. Additionally, it has a mix of efficient creatures like Flickerwisp and Orcish Bowmasters to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and mana fixing, allowing for a smooth gameplay experience.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Herigast, Erupting Nullkite. It also includes board control elements like Sowing Mycospawn and Writhing Chrysalis to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while controlling the game through spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. The combination of ramp, control, and powerful Eldrazi creatures makes this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to enable explosive plays with Primeval Titan and other powerful creatures, combining land ramp and tutoring to assemble combo pieces quickly. It aims to ramp up mana production and combo off to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The deck also incorporates utility lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field to generate additional value and provide flexibility in different game situations. Overall, the deck excels at generating explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent with its powerful combo potential.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays using low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to maintain card advantage and dig for the necessary threats and answers. With a mix of direct damage, card draw, and efficient creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and quickly finish the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using creatures with varying abilities to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing powerful multicolored spells and Leylines to control the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through efficient creature combat and burn spells. The inclusion of tribal support cards and versatile lands allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups and maximizing the deck's overall efficiency in dealing consistent damage.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's gameplay and controlling the board through a combination of efficient removal spells and disruptive creatures. By combining powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Solitude with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence of its own. Additionally, cards like Relic of Progenitus and Ephemerate provide additional value and flexibility throughout the game. The deck's strategy revolves around applying pressure early on and maintaining control of the game until victory.

Utilize a combination of cards to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones from the graveyard, using Atraxa, Grand Unifier to bolster their abilities. The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Psychic Frog and then bringing them back with Goryo's Vengeance or Ephemerate. Use Tainted Indulgence to control your opponent's graveyard and protect your combo pieces with counter spells like Force of Negation. The mana base is tuned to support the combo while still providing access to all necessary colors.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of powerful creatures and spells to create a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing a mix of control elements and combo pieces, the deck aims to quickly outpace the opponent and secure victories through a combination of aggressive plays and disruptive tactics. The lack of reliance on traditional land cards allows for a unique and flexible playstyle that can catch opponents off guard and lead to unexpected wins.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco to quickly overwhelm opponents. With aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain board control. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a versatile mana base to ensure consistent access to its colors and powerful lands like Arena of Glory to provide additional advantages in combat.

The deck is focused on using artifact creatures and spells to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch, the deck can generate mana and card advantage quickly. The combo potential with cards like Mox Amber and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student allows for explosive turns that can swing the game in your favor. The inclusion of powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury adds an extra level of pressure to the opponent.

The deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider as a key piece in a combo with Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant to quickly bring out powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Xenagos, God of Revels. It also utilizes Planar Genesis to generate mana and Summoner's Pact to search for key creatures. The deck includes a variety of cards to facilitate the combo, such as Eldritch Evolution and Neoform, as well as protection with Pact of Negation. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and utility lands to support the combo strategy effectively.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, along with support from cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the goal is to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Ranger-Captain of Eos allows for disruption and control elements, while cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Guide of Souls provide card advantage and board presence. Additionally, the mana base is optimized for consistency and speed.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with a mix of countermagic, removal spells, and creature control. By using cards like Fatal Push, Counterspell, Drown in the Loch, and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Graveyard Trespasser and Murktide Regent provides a win condition, while cards like Thought Scour and Unearth help filter through the deck for key spells. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and winning through attrition.

This deck focuses on cycling creatures and then bringing them all back from the graveyard with Living End to overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence. The deck includes various creatures with cycling abilities, as well as ways to counter opponent's plays to protect the combo. It also includes lands that enable the deck to function smoothly and efficiently. The key strategy revolves around setting up the graveyard with the right creatures and timing the Living End spell for maximum impact, often leading to a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy that disrupts the opponent's game plan while utilizing powerful creatures and removal spells. By combining creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd with cards like Ephemerate and Fatal Push, the deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while also having ways to control the board. Additionally, with cards like Relic of Progenitus and Thoughtseize, the deck can disrupt the opponent's graveyard and hand, further hindering their ability to effectively respond to the aggressive threats.

The main focus of the deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, using removal spells, and limiting their options with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils. It aims to maintain board control with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Solitude while also generating card advantage with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also includes Isochron Scepter for added versatility and utility. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them in the long run.
